content: is worked flat on the last 27 33 39 sts before borm note as i use magic loop method i just let the restof the sts stay on the long cable of my working needles you might want to move them to an additional cable/ needle if needed turn work repeatrows 1 & 2 13 16 19 times -total 26 32 38 row ● row 1 ws sl 1 p 26 32 38 tw ● row 2 rs sl 1 sl 1 wyif k1 to borm tw workrow 1once more turn work heel turn ● row 1 rs sl 1 k 16 20 24 ssk tw ● row 2 ws sl 1 p 7 9 11 p2tog tw ● row 3 rs sl 1 k 7 9 11 ssk tw ● row 4 ws same asrow 2 repeatrows 3 & 4 till all the heel sts are workedand you have 9 11 13 sts left on your needle you will be finishing with a ws row turn work ©tania barley 2022 v 1 0 3 gusset sl 1 k across 8 10 12 sts pick up and k 15 18 21 sts from the side of the heel flap place borm k across front 27 33 39 st in pattern working 4 5 6 pattern repeats of columns 1-6 and additional columns 7-9 place sm pick up and k 15 18 21 sts from the side of the heel flap k across to borm repeatrnds 1 &2 decreasingthe sts till you get back to 27 33 39 sts between sm and borm ● rnd1 work in pattern to sm sl sm ssk k to 2 stsbefore borm k2tog ● rnd2 k all working sts from borm to sm in pattern foot and toe continue working the foot sts from borm to sm in pattern and sts from sm to borm as k all till it reaches approx 4 5 5 6 cm / 1 75 2 2 5 inches shorter than final required length start decreasing sts for the toe repeatrnds 1 &2 till there are 22 30 34 total sts left - 11 15 17 sts for each front and back ● rnd1 k all ● rnd2 ssk k to 2 sts before sm k2tog sl sm ssk k to 2 sts before borm k2tog remove the markers and graft the sts together using kitchener st finishing weave in the ends wash in lukewarm water with mild soap block if needed useful links ● german twisted cast on knitting help - slow motiongerman twisted cast-on - youtube ● kitchener st knitting help - slow motion kitchenerstitch - youtube ● 3 into 3 gathered st 3 into 3 gathered stitch - youtube ©tania barley 2022 v 1 0 4 thank you so much for getting a copy of this pattern i hope that you will enjoy knitting these socks if you have any questions regarding the pattern please feel free to email me tania at info thewoolbarrow@gmail com i would
